StringTable.String: Improves soldier effectiveness and transport capacity.

StringTable.Label: GenericDroneSoldiers_Dec
StringTable.String: There are massive benefits in unit reliability and coordination if our troops are programmed to unfailingly do what we tell them to. And we won't have to feel so bad about losing these ones.

StringTable.Label: GenericAdvancedInvasionTactics_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Improves soldier effectiveness and allows construction of advanced transports.

StringTable.Label: GenericAdvancedInvasionTactics_Dec
StringTable.String: A new generation of invasion transports, along with a new generation of soldiers that don't mind being stacked like firewood, allows us to put boots on the ground faster than ever.

StringTable.Label: GenericDefenseSystemTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of basic defensive systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericDefenseSystemTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Naval crews are notoriously squishy, and otherwise difficult to protect in a ship that operates in hard vacuum. But we've got to do something, or they're going to stop getting in the ships.

StringTable.Label: GenericDefensiveSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Deflecting or diffusing incoming weapon fire is really, really hard, and we're far from having a really good understanding of it. Our latest round of research has only succeeded in making existing shield systems a bit cheaper to build.

StringTable.Label: GenericDefensiveSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Making our point defenses fire more crap into the space around the ship is a simple solution to a complicated question. Though still a surprisingly effective one.

StringTable.Label: GenericDefensiveSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: By adjusting the size and positioning of our armor panels, we've been able to minimize overlap and other inefficiencies, and can now provide the same level of protection to our ships for less overall weight.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved shield systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: No longer must our ships cower behind crude deflector fields. The latest generation of shields, although expensive, are capable of stopping incoming attacks outright, rather than just deflecting or diffusing their impact.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Of all the suggestions we've received from the field on how to improve our shield systems, "Please make them bigger," seemed to be the most popular. So we've done that.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: We probably shouldn't talk in front of the troops about our efforts to make our shield systems cheaper, even if it means more shields to go around for everyone. Because that's not how they'll see it.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: The first few generation of field emitters used in our shield systems were incredibly bulky and cumbersome. And they still are, frankly. Just a bit less so now.

StringTable.Label: GenericBarrierFieldGeneration_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced shield systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericBarrierFieldGeneration_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest generation of shields, the so-called Barrier Field, is capable of absorbing a portion of the energy which strikes it. This dramatically increases the energy efficiency of the system, allowing for ultimately much more powerful shields.

StringTable.Label: GenericBarrierSystemFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: The first generation of energy absorbers in our Barrier Field systems used a model of capacitor which occasionally exploded violently. Crews had decidedly mixed feelings about this, so we replaced those capacitors with a slightly more robust model.

StringTable.Label: GenericBarrierSystemFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Since the first few shield emitters went out the door, we've slowly been able to achieve some economies of scale in the manufacture of these systems, reducing the cost of all future installations.

StringTable.Label: GenericBarrierSystemFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: We've recently been able to shave a ton of weight off of our shield generators thanks to the latest generation of superconductors and their less extensive cooling requirements.

StringTable.Label: GenericForceFieldTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic shield systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericForceFieldTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The latest generation of shields are capable of directing vast amounts of additional energy to a specific section of shields within nanoseconds of the moment of impact, allowing for shields which are much stronger relative to their respective weight.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Cheaper shields never meant less effective shields, and it's only taken a few decades for our crews to finally understand that. Which is good, because our shields are spectacularly cheap now.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: It's impossible to make the energy emitters of our shields any denser our engineers claim. They claim that kind of thing a lot and always take it back later, but they seem pretty sure this time.

StringTable.Label: GenericInvulnerabilityTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate shield systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericInvulnerabilityTech_Dec
StringTable.String: "Invulnerable" may be a bit of an exaggeration. Our researchers allow that some theoretical weapons could penetrate these shields. But those would be some pretty terrifying weapons, and even then you'd rather be behind this shield than not.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldSupportSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of shield support systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldSupportSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: Advances in the focusing capabilities of our shield generators has given us the ability to generate and augment the shields of friendly ships. This should provide massive tactical and strategic options for fleet operations.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldAugmentation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved shield support systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: The same technology we've used to generate shields at a distance can now be done with our Barrier Field systems, allowing for even greater improvements in fleet survivability.

StringTable.Label: GenericEnergyFieldManipulation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced shield support systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericEnergyFieldManipulation_Dec
StringTable.String: Our mastery of the energy fields needed to create and maintain shields has resulted in a couple interesting new technologies, capable of interfering with enemy shield systems, or massively shielding friendly units within range.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenses_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenses_Dec
StringTable.String: Arrays of tiny computer controlled railguns that track and destroy incoming missiles are unparalleled at protecting ships and starbases from missile attacks, though they still aren't terribly helpful at defending against other classes of weapons.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenseOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: A careful analysis of various missile performance envelopes has led us to adjust the firing patterns of our point defense systems, making them a bit more effective.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenseOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: The sensor equipment our point defense systems use is fairly specialized equipment that was initially quite rare and costly. Now that we're building a lot of point defenses, the price of those systems is starting to come down.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenseOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: The slugs fired by point defenses don't need to be large, and were limited by the fact that we couldn't build railguns any smaller. But now that we can build more compact units, we should see significant weight savings for all our point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericCounterMeasures_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericCounterMeasures_Dec
StringTable.String: By deploying electronic counter measures which interfere with and confuse incoming missile attacks, we've greatly increased the survivability of our ships and starbases. Against missiles at least. Still hard to confuse a laser.

StringTable.Label: GenericCounterMeasureFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: There's always a generational game of leap frog being played between missile designers and ECM designers, but we believe our latest algorithms have given us the leg up on the bad guys this time.

StringTable.Label: GenericCounterMeasureFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our earliest attempts at ECM suites were heavily customizable, requiring a great deal of hand tuning to make them perform at their best. Now that we know what works, we can automate much more of the manufacturing and installation process.

StringTable.Label: GenericCounterMeasureFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our first ECM suites were cobbled together from a half dozen different processors and transmitters. We've since streamlined those into a single unit which weighs much less.

StringTable.Label: GenericDroneSentrySystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericDroneSentrySystems_Dec
StringTable.String: By installing our point defense systems on drone platforms that orbit our ships at a distance, we can add a valuable extra layer of protection against missile attacks.

StringTable.Label: GenericDroneSystemMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: To be fair, only a few of our drone systems have ever actually shot each other in combat situations. But by minimizing that just a little bit more, we should be able to make our point defenses a little more cost-effective, if a bit less funny.

StringTable.Label: GenericDroneSystemMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Once we realized point defense drones don't need much personal space, we were able to start packing them in a lot tighter.

StringTable.Label: GenericArreonMissileDefenseTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericArreonMissileDefenseTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The ultimate in point defense technology, featuring the latest generation of micro-drones armed with railguns, ECM and smart chafe. Aereon systems fill the space around a ship with a cloud of debris so thick no enemy missiles are likely to survive.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenseSupportSystem_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of point defense support systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenseSupportSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: Our experience working with small scale point defenses has led to a type of long range missile tracking system which should enhance the point defense capabilities of an entire fleet.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenseAugmentation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved point defense support systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenseAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: Wide area missile disruptors enhance the effectiveness of our existing counter measures, adding a much needed layer of extra missile security to our fleets.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenseManipulation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced point defense support systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenseManipulation_Dec
StringTable.String: Fleet-wide drone systems will provide massive missile security to an entire fleet. Additionally we can now equip point defense disruptors, essentially a type of counter-counter-measure, which should boost the effectiveness of our own missile attacks.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved armor systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: A big lump of ultra-dense material remains an effective, if unsubtle, method of protection from modern space-based weaponry. Subtlety is overrated though.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: A simple mistake by one of our fabricators resulted in a set of armor panels marginally denser and more resilient than we'd seen before. It took us a long time to replicate that mistake, but now that we have, our ships should be a little tougher to kill.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: One of the biggest challenges with armor manufacturing was simply the logistics of moving rare and heavy resources and materials around. Now that we've got our supply chain sorted out, we can expect to see some nice cost savings.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: By its very nature, armor is always going to be a fairly mass-intensive means of protection. That said, we can do a few things to improve the precision and fit of armor plating, which should cut down on weight a bit.

StringTable.Label: GenericDurantiumCompositeTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced armor systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericDurantiumCompositeTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Certain materials, when stacked in specific arrangements have a synergistic effect on the strength of their neighbors under compressive forces. We call these new composites Durantium, and they should tremendously increase the survivability of our ships.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: A careful study of battle-damaged ships has revealed previously unknown weaknesses in our armor systems. Basically, we know why some of them were cracking in half now. We'll do something about that right away.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: If our crews ask, it's not that our armor is cheap. It's that we've found a more efficient way of manufacturing it. But yes, it is pretty cheap.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Some experiments with the arrangement of our Durantium composites has revealed that we can get away with slightly less dense materials at certain layers with no impact to the armor's effectiveness.

StringTable.Label: GenericKanviumLaminateTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic armor systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericKanviumLaminateTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Kanvium armor uses a new type of lamination which causes surrounding materials to partially fluidize on impact, deforming in a recoverable way. Impacts are spread out over a much larger area, then flow back into its original shape.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: With modern armoring systems, the design of the armor informs the shape of the ship as much as the other way around. Properly armoring a ship involves a complicated series of trade offs, which when we get right, mean ships protected for much cheaper.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: On a weight basis, our armor systems are now as efficient as they can possibly be, 99.3% of all total installed mass dedicated to offensive energy absorption or dispersion. That's really, really good the researchers promise.

StringTable.Label: GenericZeroPointArmorTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate armor systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericZeroPointArmorTech_Dec
StringTable.String: We have a hard time proving zero point armor even exists, only knowing of it by the effect it has. It appears to tap into the zero-point energy of the quantum vacuum to repulse incoming energy. It's almost impossibly tough, we can prove that much.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorSupportSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of armor support systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorSupportSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: In the factory, we've begun producing armor plating with a variety of force field based technologies. By adapting these fields into ship modules, we can create a hardening effect at a distance, making every ship in a fleet substantially more durable.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorEnhancement_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved armor support systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorEnhancement_Dec
StringTable.String: The fields that we use to generate hardening effects have twenty seven different "poles" which can be cycled through, changing the alignment of the hardening effects in the affected material, generating substantially stronger, more resilient materials.

StringTable.Label: GenericIntegrityFieldProjection_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced armor support systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericIntegrityFieldProjection_Dec
StringTable.String: Our latest generation of armoring fields no longer just generate hardening effects at a distance, but can induce material fluidization and shape recovery. These new Integrity Fields can make our fleets invulnerable to all but the most powerful attacks.

StringTable.Label: GenericCommunicationsTech_Dec
StringTable.String: We've already seen glimpses of evidence that we're not alone in this galaxy. Which presents an incredible danger, but also, perhaps, an opportunity. But also, let's stress again, danger.

StringTable.Label: GenericTranslatorTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Can begin communicating with aliens. Boosts diplomacy.

StringTable.Label: GenericTranslatorTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Intense study of the fragments of alien text and speech has allowed us to create a Universal Translator that will let us communicate with any new races we come across.

StringTable.Label: GenericDiplomaticSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: We've begun simulating different rhetorical and diplomatic approaches when dealing with aliens, revealing several ways we might improve their attitudes towards us. Our role-playing has enabled us to talk prettier, essentially.

StringTable.Label: GenericDiplomaticSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our culture has a way of communicating what our diplomats cannot. By increasing the ease with which other civilizations can access our culture we can win hearts and minds before we even get to the negotiating table.

StringTable.Label: GenericDiplomaticSpecialization3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases the number of Administrators your Civilization can support.

StringTable.Label: GenericDiplomaticSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: As our Civilization grows, we find ourselves needing more and more Administrators to oversee our far flung Starbases.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarGovernance_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows use of Stellar Empire form of government, and increases our Administrative capacity.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarGovernance_Dec
StringTable.String: Governing a civilization on this scale parallels our experience exploring our own world hundreds of years ago. A history we'd better refamiliarize ourselves with quickly, before we get any space tea dumped in our harbors.

StringTable.Label: GenericPoliticalSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Federalist parties advocate a relatively weak central government that offloads much of its responsibility to lower, more local governmental groups. This bias towards local regulation seems to encourage economic development.

StringTable.Label: GenericPoliticalSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Populist forms of government are designed to make people happy, even at the cost of economic strength. As a side-effect of this relentless interest in pleasing others, Populist governments are often very good at diplomacy.

StringTable.Label: GenericPoliticalSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Universalist governments attempt to be all things to all people. That can be a lot of people, none of whom ever seem to agree on anything, but a balanced approach like this at least ensures a government has no weak spots.

StringTable.Label: GenericGalacticGovernance_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows use of Galactic Republic form of government, and increases our Administrative capacity.

StringTable.Label: GenericGalacticGovernance_Dec
StringTable.String: By granting limited powers of self rule to various elements of society, reserving the most critical functions for our own central government, we expect to see increased public satisfaction and all the benefits which come with it.

StringTable.Label: GenericPoliticalFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Industrialist governments seek to maximize industrial capacity by rewarding citizens based entirely on their productivity. From top to bottom, society is organized to encourage hard work and not having fun.

StringTable.Label: GenericPoliticalFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Mercantilists seek to ensure their civilization's prosperity through trade, via careful negotiations, brutally unfair tariff, and outright espionage.

StringTable.Label: GenericPoliticalFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Any time two civilizations have met the less technologically advanced one has come out worse from the encounter. Technologists dedicate all governmental resources to ensure that they never become that dumber civilization.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarDemocracyTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows use of Interstellar Democracy form of government, and increases our Administrative capacity.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarDemocracyTech_Dec
StringTable.String: A system which lets people pick their own rulers, or at least think they're picking their own rulers, has obvious merits in terms of approval and productivity, although adapting it to a civilization this big has proven challenging.

StringTable.Label: GenericPoliticalMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: Whether it's because they consider all other civilizations to be inferior, or simply terrifying, members of the War Party are willing to put their entire civilization on a military footing to do something about it.

StringTable.Label: GenericPoliticalMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Pacifist governments forego the language of aggression and militarization and focus all their efforts on promoting culture and social welfare. This makes them well liked in the galactic community, and their words travel far.

StringTable.Label: GenericStarFederationTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows use of Star Federation form of government, and increases our Administrative capacity.

StringTable.Label: GenericStarFederationTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The ultimate in space based governance, an ideal blend of all the freedoms, responsibilities, and delicious seasonings which make up an ideal civic life.

StringTable.Label: GenericDiplomacyTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of embassies and the formation of basic treaties.

StringTable.Label: GenericDiplomacyTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The profit potential an alliance with our neighbors offers is something we should always consider. And failing that, the cost of talking with them will be a fraction of the cost of going to war with then.

StringTable.Label: GenericDiplomaticOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Economic treaties will lower tariffs and other obstacles that discourage business activities. When well designed, these treaties should result in increased wealth for both parties.

StringTable.Label: GenericDiplomaticOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: By increasing the interchange of cultural products and making it easier for civilians to cross borders, we can hope to increase the influence we have on our neighbors.

StringTable.Label: GenericDiplomaticOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: By entering into formal information sharing agreements with other civilizations, our researchers can more easily accumulate the masses of data which modern research often requires.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarAlliances_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved diplomatic buildings. Increases Diplomacy.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarAlliances_Dec
StringTable.String: Turning a friendly species into a formal ally is a supremely delicate process. There's only one way these talks can go right, and a thousand ways they can go wrong. The etiquette of alien handshakes alone is fraught with peril.

StringTable.Label: GenericAllianceFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: Formal military alliances will make a war with humanity that much more imposing to our foes. The trade-off is that we risk being drawn into wars not of our choosing. Friends are cheap to have, but allies can be very expensive indeed.

StringTable.Label: GenericAllianceFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: A technological alliance will dramatically ramp up the research sharing programs we have with our ally. This is valuable information, so we must be sure of their friendship before entering such an agreement.

StringTable.Label: GenericAllianceFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: A formal cultural alliance will lower almost all barriers to the movement of people and ideas across borders with our neighbor. Not only will this bring us closer, we can hope to have a bigger influence on our neighbor's culture.

StringTable.Label: GenericEminenceTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced diplomatic buildings. Increases Diplomacy.

StringTable.Label: GenericEminenceTech_Dec
StringTable.String: A civilization which takes diplomacy seriously and has a long record of fair-minded dealing will always carry a greater voice at the bargaining table. Our people are building that reputation now, and are stronger for it.

StringTable.Label: GenericMajestyTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The galaxy wants to believe every word we say. So sterling is our reputation, that our diplomats often find whole worlds begging to join our culture. The pen hasn't just beaten the sword; it's humiliated it.

StringTable.Label: GenericUnitedPlanetsLobbyist_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Unlocks additional Resolutions to be proposed.

StringTable.Label: GenericUnitedPlanetsLobbyist_Dec
StringTable.String: There's a shocking amount of backroom dealing which goes on behind the surface of the United Planets. But that's how the sausage is made, and we'll do well if we're better at it than our enemies. And our allies.

StringTable.Label: GenericUnitedPlanetsClout_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Unlocks more powerful Resolutions to be proposed.

StringTable.Label: GenericUnitedPlanetsClout_Dec
StringTable.String: Our allies have long been convinced of the benefits of our friendship. Now they see the benefit of our wisdom and leadership. We can no rely on their unwavering support on all United Planets matters.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalInfluence_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of basic cultural buildings. Increases Influence.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalInfluence_Dec
StringTable.String: A strong cultural presence, on our worlds and our neighbors' has tremendous long term potential. It lacks some of the visceral appeal of a new type of mass driver, but may in the long run be far more effective at securing humanity's future.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that our culture has made inroads on the planets of our neighbors, we can help cement this influence by encouraging our biggest stars to regularly visit and vacation there, serving as ambassadors for our way of life.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: Although artists and designers aren't naturally inclined towards thinking about money, after we locked a few of them in a room with an accountant for a bit, they managed to find a number of ways they could do their work more efficiently.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalOptimization3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces maintenance costs of cultural buildings.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our cultural facilities cost real money to maintain. By encouraging our artists and directors to reuse materials, props, and punch lines whenever possible, we can reduce the ongoing costs of running these enterprises.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalOutreach_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved cultural buildings. Increases Influence.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalOutreach_Dec
StringTable.String: By building facilities that focus on spreading our cultural accomplishments amongst our civilians and neighbors, we expect to see even more influence in this region of space, or at the very least, more awards from the artistic community.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: By adapting our cultural products to cast scientists and researchers in a more favorable light, we might find appreciative audiences among research communities.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalFocus2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases Influence on planets with high approval.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: A culture which focuses on its leaders is a fine thing to have when those leaders are doing a good job. When the leaders aren't doing a good job, it's filled with harsh satire and unflattering impressions, so watch out for that.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: If people have money, let's not make them ashamed of it. By encouraging displays of conspicuous consumption and a culture which celebrates wealth, we can gain a great deal of influence with people living the good life.

StringTable.Label: GenericStellarEmigration_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced cultural buildings. Increases Influence.

StringTable.Label: GenericStellarEmigration_Dec
StringTable.String: Humans are admired throughout the galaxy, reflecting the success of our civilization. If we can make the process of emigration easier, we can spread our influence wider still.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalAssimilation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic cultural buildings. Increases Influence.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalAssimilation_Dec
StringTable.String: Foreign cultures have such backwards ideas that we'll find great value in quickly assimilating and removing the cultural trappings of new arrivals. By doing so can increase the penetration and acceptance of our culture more still.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalDomination_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate cultural buildings. Increases Influence.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalDomination_Dec
StringTable.String: There is no other culture in the galaxy but ours, and anyone who claims otherwise is a heretic. Or just dumb. All sane beings will soon bow down before our celebrities and thinkers.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalAffinity_Dec
StringTable.String: Other universes deserve the benefit of humanity's wisdom and culture. Indeed, it's a bit offensive that they don't see it already. Our thinkers are now beginning to prepare plans for shining our light on the next world, and beyond.

StringTable.Label: GenericTechnologicalOutreach_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Greatly Increases the spread of our colonies Influence for 15 Turns. (Capstone)

StringTable.Label: GenericTechnologicalOutreach_Dec
StringTable.String: Our researchers have been instructed to bend those giant brains of Thiers toward finding ways to reach out to the scientist and researchers of other races, and find ways to convince them our way of doing things is the best way to insure technological advancement for the galaxy as a whole.

StringTable.Label: GenericXenoCommerce_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of basic economic buildings and freighters.

StringTable.Label: GenericXenoCommerce_Dec
StringTable.String: An economy which spans the stars is a pretty complicated beast. We don't need to understand it all of course, just supply the facilities and light regulations for the free market to get to work doing what it does best.

StringTable.Label: GenericCommerceSpecialization1_Dec
StringTable.String: With targeted tax rates, we can encourage a number of different areas of our economy. A tax policy which favors business and investment should ultimately lead to a wealthier economy for example. Unless the businesses and investors were lying to us.

StringTable.Label: GenericCommerceSpecialization2_Dec
StringTable.String: By targeting economic policy to support workers and the civilian population in general, we can ensure we have a much broader base of approval to build our civilization on.

StringTable.Label: GenericCommerceSpecialization3_Dec
StringTable.String: Encouraging and supporting trade is a great way to both bring in extra income and forge closer ties with our neighbors. Everyone's happy when they're making money.

StringTable.Label: GenericXenoEconomics_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved economic buildings.

StringTable.Label: GenericXenoEconomics_Dec
StringTable.String: The sheer distance between buyers and sellers in this economy has resulted in us having to rewrite a number of different theories of economics. At minimum, some new banking and economic structures will be required to deal with all the complications.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarBanking_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced economic buildings.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarBanking_Dec
StringTable.String: Capital can now be transferred instantaneously. This has allowed a variety of creative arbitrage opportunities, which will require new regulations and banking theory to contain.

StringTable.Label: GenericEconomicFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: An economy which prioritizes external trading will be well suited to exploit the wealth of the greater galactic community, or just exploit the greater galactic community in general.

StringTable.Label: GenericEconomicFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: There is a certain art in the framing of a treaty, and even in an agreement between equals, one party can be more equal than the other. Let's be that more equal party.

StringTable.Label: GenericEconomicFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: By reducing the obstacles that foreign tourists might face when trying to visit us, we can encourage more of them to travel here and more of their money to stay here.

StringTable.Label: GenericFinancialSectorsTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic economic buildings.

StringTable.Label: GenericFinancialSectorsTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Dedicated financial sectors should help facilitate the flow of capital across our civilization, which will result in more things being built in the places they need to. Wealth creation, in other words, which we can tap for a variety of purposes.

StringTable.Label: GenericGalacticStockMarket_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate economic buildings.

StringTable.Label: GenericGalacticStockMarket_Dec
StringTable.String: Stock exchanges have proven remarkably elusive to establish in this galaxy, and only the most recent advances in communications technology and regulatory capability have made them possible.

StringTable.Label: GenericEconomicStudy_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Substantially boost our civilization's Wealth for 15 Turns. (Capstone)

StringTable.Label: GenericEconomicStudy_Dec
StringTable.String: It's seems for the right price we have been able to incentivize our researchers to focus on assorted ways to boost our colonies Wealth. Unfortunately we will not be able to keep this up to long, or they will all realize they can make much better livings in the private sector.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarTrade_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of basic trading buildings. Adds two trade routes.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarTrade_Dec
StringTable.String: Exchanging goods with our neighbors will theoretically enrich us both, and is worth pursuing for that reason alone. Also, if we play it smart, it can enrich us a lot more than the other guy.

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeOptimization1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases overall value of trade routes

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: By optimizing both the outgoing and receiving ends of our trade routes we have been able to achieve a modest overall profit for everyone involved.

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeOptimization2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows the establishment of one additional trade route.

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: We believe the best way to increase trade income is the establish more trade routes. With a bit of effort we have been able to stretch our recourses enough to establish one more.

StringTable.Label: GenericGalacticTrade_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved trading buildings. Adds two trade routes.

StringTable.Label: GenericGalacticTrade_Dec
StringTable.String: By establishing fixed trading hubs and encouraging the markets which develop around them, the wealth of the entire galactic community will flow through our hands. Our ever so slightly sticky hands.

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeFocus1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases overall value of trade routes

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: By establishing a trade tariffs on our colonies we have been able to increase our trade route profits substantially.

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeFocus2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows the establishment of one additional trade route

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: More trade routes, more trade income, who no need for Tariffs, or 'Luxury items', Some times its best to stick to the basics.

StringTable.Label: GenericGalacticFacilitation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced trading buildings. Adds two trade routes.

StringTable.Label: GenericGalacticFacilitation_Dec
StringTable.String: The sheer volume of goods that pass through a trading port is staggering, and we'll need new facilities to manage the flow of goods smoothly. And safely. We've had a few too many large masses make dock workers very, very flat.

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeMasters_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic trading buildings. Adds two trade routes.

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeMasters_Dec
StringTable.String: Our civilization is synonymous with wealth and trading, and all intelligent beings know our markets are the only viable place to show their goods. And of course certain advantages accrue to the owners of such a monopoly.

StringTable.Label: GenericXenoEntertainment_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of basic entertainment buildings. Increases Approval.

StringTable.Label: GenericXenoEntertainment_Dec
StringTable.String: Without the approval of our people, we won't be able to accomplish very much. Distracting them with various amusements is perhaps a cynical ploy, but it might be easier than trying to treat them as the rational beings they're so often not.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarTourism_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved entertainment buildings. Begin collecting tourism income.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarTourism_Dec
StringTable.String: Not only can we distract our own citizens with amusements, we can begin luring friendly visitors from our galactic neighbors. This will not only help improve relations, it should result in extra income for us.

StringTable.Label: GenericPopulationDiversion_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced entertainment buildings.

StringTable.Label: GenericPopulationDiversion_Dec
StringTable.String: More amusements! Bigger amusements! Human beings are dreadfully simple sometimes, which is distressing on some level, even if it does make them pretty easy to manage.

StringTable.Label: GenericApprovalFocus1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increase the morale of your colonies.

StringTable.Label: GenericApprovalFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: We have discovered that we can make people feel more confident and happy. With proper messaging, we can keep our citizens happy without all that costly infrastructure.

StringTable.Label: GenericApprovalFocus2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Makes building Entertainment Improvements much cheaper.

StringTable.Label: GenericApprovalFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: We have discovered that our efforts in keeping our people distracted have paid off. We can now build anything, and they will think it is fun.

StringTable.Label: GenericApprovalFocus3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Greatly reduces the Maintenance required by Entertainment Improvements.

StringTable.Label: GenericApprovalFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Not only are our people easier to please, they will now do most of the work it takes to distract themselves, for free.

StringTable.Label: GenericIndustrialSpecialization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: It only took a few horrific accidents for us to finally come to grips with the challenges of off-world industry, and now that we have, we've identified a number of ways we can begin improving and specializing our industrial capacity.

StringTable.Label: GenericConstructionOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Seemingly small improvements can have a big effect when applied to large projects, and we're working on some very large projects now indeed.

StringTable.Label: GenericManufacturingFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: There's no getting around it: "Incremental improvements in manufacturing techniques" isn't much of a headline. Which is a shame, considering the benefit we expect to see from them.

StringTable.Label: GenericIndustrialMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: If it can be dreamed up, we can build it. Indeed, many of our economists now believe that the limiting factor of our industrial capacity is our own imaginations.

StringTable.Label: GenericResearchOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Researchers are great at inventing things, but surprisingly bad at the business of inventing things. A number of inefficient research practices have developed which we really need to improve upon.

StringTable.Label: GenericTechnologicalFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: The lab equipment needed to research some of these new fields is incredibly expensive and esoteric. Specializing our research efforts may be necessary to make the most rapid advances.

StringTable.Label: GenericPlanetarySpecialization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: We've made great strides with our colonization techniques in the past few years, and can now begin considering specific areas we'd like to improve upon.

StringTable.Label: GenericAgriculturalOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Optimizing our farming processes will lead to a number of benefits which will help our civilization for a very long time. Until people stop needing food, really.

StringTable.Label: GenericFarmingFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Although all this attention we pay to improving our farming techniques sometimes make our farmers uncomfortable - they do get set in their ways - the improvements to our food production capacity are too great to ignore.

StringTable.Label: GenericAgriculturalMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Our farms now provide an almost unlimited bounty, the food doing much of the hard work itself. Admittedly, the first time you see a plant or animal self-harvest is a little grim, and school field trips have certainly gotten a lot harder.

StringTable.Label: GenericColonizationFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Mastering living on an extreme world will make life there a lot more tolerable for the poor fools who volunteered for it.

StringTable.Label: GenericBiospherePerfection_ShortDec
StringTable.String: No longer must our colonists die without cause. Even the deadliest of planets are now perfectly surviable to us.

StringTable.Label: GenericInterstellarSpecialization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Now that we have a bit of experience sending ships out into the darkness and having most of them come back, we've come up with a number of ways to improve our equipment and navigational techniques.

StringTable.Label: GenericIonOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Now that we've seen them in wide-scale use, we've identified a number of ways we can make our new Ion Drive systems more efficient.

StringTable.Label: GenericWarpFieldFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Warp field technology is incredibly complicated, and has in more than a few cases, caused a researcher's brains to melt a little bit. But now that we have some experience working with them, we've identified a number of ways to improve their design.

StringTable.Label: GenericHyperwarpMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Our ships are already the fastest in the galaxy, our engineers heralded as heroes wherever they go. Fortunately for us, they don't like going out much, instead preferring to keep looking for more improvements to make to their precious engines.

StringTable.Label: GenericSensorOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: A concentrated effort to optimize our sensor systems could lead to a number of different improvements or efficiencies.

StringTable.Label: GenericEnergyFieldFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: As is usually the case when equipment is sent to the field, the technicians who actually use our sensors soon came up with a number of different ways to improve their efficiency and effectiveness.

StringTable.Label: GenericSensorMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: We don't anticipate any further increases in the viewing range of our sensors, not until we leave this universe for another one. But we can certainly make them a little more efficient.

StringTable.Label: GenericPrecursorRelicFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Having captured a few Precursor relics and observed the impact they have on our research and culture, we can now try adjusting our Precursor studies to benefit specific areas of our civilization.

StringTable.Label: GenericLifeSupportOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Everyone in the navy is very excited that we're trying to optimize our life support systems, and would certainly cheer if they weren't conserving their air.

StringTable.Label: GenericSupportFieldFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Our early attempts at building field-based life support systems left behind many messes and many possible opportunities for improvement, which we're starting to identify now. Cleaning up the messes: that was the obvious one.

StringTable.Label: GenericLifeSupportMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: We have all but mastered direct-nutrient injection technologies, and now have left but a few additional efficiencies to wring out of these systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericOrbitalSpecialization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Now that we've watched a few construction projects accidentally collapse on themselves, we've identified a number of possible improvements we can make to our orbital construction techniques.

StringTable.Label: GenericZeroGravityOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: We took a big step forward with our most recent adoption of true zero-gravity construction practices. Now, after a few trial runs and one teensy little accident, our engineers have identified further areas for improvement.

StringTable.Label: GenericOrbitalConstructionFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: We're getting better and better at large scale construction with every passing day, and a number of more efficient design practices are beginning to show up on our engineers' drawing tables. Along with the offensive doodles which have always been there.

StringTable.Label: GenericHullMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: We're still finding ways to improve our shipyards, even though they're already the envy of the civilized galaxy. In the uncivilized galaxy they're a bit less envied, but we've never gotten along with those guys anyways.

StringTable.Label: GenericCarrierFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: There's nothing like doing something a few times to see how terrible you are at it. After a few hilarious mishaps, we've identified a few ways we can improve our carrier operations.

StringTable.Label: GenericLogisticalOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: A new generation of space accountants are becoming trained as we speak, capable of improving logistical efficiencies most people would be too bored to ever notice.

StringTable.Label: GenericWeaponsSpecialization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: By dedicating their efforts on a specific field of weapons technology, our researchers believe they can deliver a number of more efficient weapon systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericBeamWeaponOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Weapons researchers have to keep paces with advances in many other fields to get the most out of their inventions. Right now, recent advances in material sciences are opening the door to a new generation of more efficient weapons.

StringTable.Label: GenericHighEnergyFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: A careful analysis of data returned from the field has revealed a number of inefficiencies which we can begin addressing in the next generation of our beam systems. We may also finally be able to get rid of that funny smell they make.

StringTable.Label: GenericBeamWeaponMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Our beam weapons are now absurdly powerful, a terror for anyone foolish enough to get on humanity's wrong side. And yet still our weapon scientists find ways to do better.

StringTable.Label: GenericMissileOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: After blowing up several thousand target drones and one unfortunate asteroid, our weapons engineers have come up with a number of possible improvements we can implement for our missile platforms.

StringTable.Label: GenericWarheadFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: We've spent comparatively little research time on the warhead components of our missile systems, but now that we've turned our attention to the matter, a number of possible efficiencies should be achievable with a little effort.

StringTable.Label: GenericPayloadMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Various physical limits of this particular universe prevent us from wringing more destructive potential out of this generation of warheads. But we can certainly make them cheaper and lighter.

StringTable.Label: GenericKineticOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Some modest improvements in the energy delivery systems of our kinetic weapons could result in improvements to the cost, mass, or range of each unit.

StringTable.Label: GenericKineticAccelerationFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Recent advances in superconducting technology should lead to improvements in the critical energy delivery systems of our kinetic weapons.

StringTable.Label: GenericKineticMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: After several generations of whipping things at other things as fast as possible, our scientists are now really quite good at it. There remain but a few small efficiencies to wring out of the field.

StringTable.Label: GenericInvasionOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Good news! We've developed some new, possibly amoral, certainly effective techniques for pacifying enemy ground forces.

StringTable.Label: GenericGravitationalFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Our ability to manipulate gravitational fields presents several unique tactical possibilities for our ground forces. These are powerful weapons we're giving to guys with pretty thick skulls, so we should definitely remember to keep an eye on them.

StringTable.Label: GenericDefensiveSpecialization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: After studying the wreckage of a few vessels we've lost in combat, our engineers have come up with a number of possible improvements we can make to our defensive technologies.

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: We've received quite a bit of useful data on real world performance of our shield systems, and have devised several possible improvements we can begin making to them.

StringTable.Label: GenericBarrierSystemFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: A careful design review of our initial implementation of the Barrier Field system has revealed a number of possible avenues for further improvements. Who says design reviews are unexciting?

StringTable.Label: GenericShieldMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Our shielding technology approaches perfection, our engineers pushing the capabilities of our shield systems right to their theoretical limits.

StringTable.Label: GenericPointDefenseOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Optimizing our point defense systems should lead to a number of different performance gains. Like possibly less exploded ships.

StringTable.Label: GenericCounterMeasureFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Now that we have some field data on ECM suite performance, we've identified a number of different ways we can improve upon the design and construction of those systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericDroneSystemMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Drone systems dramatically increased the sheer volume of our point defense capabilities, so any small improvement in their design should lead to significant cost or weight savings.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: We've blown up lots and lots of slabs of armor on the test range, and have come up with a few possible improvements we could make to our armor systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Our armor systems have increased significantly in complexity, and our efforts to model their behavior under impact is only now catching up. This research should help lead to more effective or efficient designs.

StringTable.Label: GenericArmorMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Our mastery of hardening techniques is almost complete, and the galaxy trembles at the girth of our vessels. But even perfection can be improved upon it seems. Some more effort should lead to cheaper or more efficient armor systems.

StringTable.Label: GenericDiplomaticSpecialization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: The words we use have a limited ability to affect the way we think, and by studying the vocabulary used by our neighbors, we may unlock valuable insights into their mindsets. And possibly even find out how to manipulate them.

StringTable.Label: GenericPoliticalSpecialization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: There are several broad ways to organize the government of a space faring civilization, all of which pose distinct advantages and disadvantages. Rest assured, there's no right choice here; regardless of what we pick, everyone will tell us that we made the wrong choice.

StringTable.Label: GenericPoliticalFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: As we continue to manage, and often mis-manage, our affairs, it's become clear that a number of political theories we'd never previously considered viable might actually be very practical when practiced on a galactic scale.

StringTable.Label: GenericPoliticalMastery_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Coordinating the direction of an entire galactic civilization is tremendously difficult. But thanks to advances in deceit and brain injection technology, we can now put this whole show entirely on a war footing, or, if we choose, the exact opposite.

StringTable.Label: GenericDiplomaticOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Depending on the current state of our civilization, we profit more from some types of treaties than others, and should begin slanting our diplomatic posture in those directions right away.

StringTable.Label: GenericAllianceFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Alliances come in a variety of flavors, some of which may be more advantageous to us than others. We should consider our civilization's priorities - and what our new ally is actually good for - before entering such talks.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Although the artists responsible for our cultural delivery vehicles like the extra funding we shovel in their direction, few appreciate the suggestion that they could possibly do things more efficiently. They can though. A lot.

StringTable.Label: GenericCulturalFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Few works of art and cultural artifacts have broad appeal, and it's often necessary to target one's audience to some extent. By fine tuning the tone and content of our cultural products, we might appeal to demographics which are particularly valuable to us.

StringTable.Label: GenericCommerceSpecialization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: With a bit of experience managing and regulating markets on a massive scale, we're now able to target specific economic improvements we might like to see.

StringTable.Label: GenericEconomicFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Now that we have a better understanding of the quirks of galactic scale economies, we can begin trimming back the regulations and policies that seem to be causing inefficiencies in specific industries and areas.

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeOptimization_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Trading is as much an art as a science, but by inducing our traders to use just a smidge more science, they might be able to maximize their profits when dealing with certain counterparties.

StringTable.Label: GenericTradeFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Now that we have a reputation as fair dealers and market makers, it should be possible to target our trading activities to encourage specific economic sectors.

StringTable.Label: GenericApprovalFocus_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Our cultural engineers inform us that some well planned manipulations of our cultural materials could make our people happier with what they already have. Which seems too good of an opportunity to pass up.
